en.title: Your claim for the divorce costs
en.applicationYouAsked: In your application you asked the court that your {{ case.divorceWho }} pay the costs of the divorce. Your {{ case.divorceWho }} has
en.courtWillDecide: It is up to the court to decide how the costs will be split, but it will take into account any requests you and your husband make.
en.readMore: Read more about the costs order
en.shouldPayCosts: The court will make its decision on whether you should pay any costs if you decide to continue. It will take all your circumstances into account, including your conduct, and your {{ case.divorceWho }}'s conduct, before and during the divorce.
en.divorceWillBeGranted: You'll be given the court's decision at the same time as you find out if the divorce will be granted, and the date of the hearing that the decree nisi will be made.
en.respondents2YearSep: In divorces based on 2 years separation, the court will usually make an order that the respondent pay half of the applicant's costs.
en.rulesInFavour: If the court rules in your favour, your {{ case.divorceWho }} will be ordered to pay you back your costs within 14 days of the order being made.
en.disputeTheCosts: Your {{ session.divorceWho }} can dispute the costs order. They'll need to tell the court why they don't think they should pay at least 14 days before the hearing.
